description: Macau begins the rolling out of Sinopharm vaccines on 10th February 2021, with frontline government workers and those who have to travel to high-risked areas being prioritized.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Administering of the vaccine (i.e. giving people the vaccine shot)
type_vac_mix: This distribution policy is not about mixing and matching of different vaccines.
type_vac_group: Certain populations based on demographic characteristics/epidemiological risk given preference for vaccinations
type_vac_who_pays: Vaccine is free for the individual
type_vac_loc: All medical institutions allowed to administer vaccines
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Priority Group 1: Essential medical workers,Essential non-medical workers (e.g. grocery store clerks),Other population

description: The Macau government halts BioNTech shots due to defective vials starting from 24th March.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Regulatory approval process for administering the COVID-19 vaccine
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From January 1, Macao implemented body temperature screening to passengers on flights departing from Wuhan at Macao International Airport. More manpower has been deployed to various cross-boundary checkpoints, especially the airport, to reinforce health inspection and quarantine efforts.
type_sub_cat: Health Screenings (e.g. temperature checks)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: From January 4, Macau conducted temperature screening to drivers and travellers who enter Macao via land-based checkpoints
type_sub_cat: Health Screenings (e.g. temperature checks)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On January 23, Macau enforced health declaration in various ports of entry. Declaration can be made by paper-based or electronic means.
type_sub_cat: Total border crossing ban
target_geog_level: All countries

description: From January 27, Macau required visitors from Hubei Province and visitors who have been to Hubei Province within the past 14 days to present a valid health certificate certifying that they are free from COVID-19 in order to enter Macao
type_sub_cat: Health Certificates
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: From February 20, Macau required all non-resident workers, who have been to the mainland in the 14 days prior to their arrival in Macao, to complete a 14-day period of medical observation at designated venue in Zhuhai, and to obtain a certificate of completion of medical observation issued by Zhuhai health authorities before entering Macau.
type_sub_cat: Health Certificates
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On February 20, Macau set up examination stations at border checkpoints to carry out medical examination on arriving travellers from countries/areas with potential risk or high incidence of COVID-19, as well as local residents with multiple border crossings between Macao and Zhuhai in a single day.
type_sub_cat: Health Screenings (e.g. temperature checks)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: From March 18, Macau prohibited all non-Macao residents from entering Macao, except residents of mainland China, of Hong Kong and of Taiwan, as well as holders of non-resident worker’s identification card
type_sub_cat: Total border crossing ban
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: From March 19, Macau prohibited Macao-registered non-resident workers from overseas countries from re-entering Macao, except those who at the same time are residents either of mainland China, Hong Kong or Taiwan
type_sub_cat: Total border crossing ban
target_geog_level: All countries

description: From March 25, Macau prohibited all residents of mainland China, Hong Kong and Taiwan who have visited a foreign country within 14 days prior to arriving Macao from entering Macao
type_sub_cat: Total border crossing ban
target_geog_level: All countries

description: From May 11, all arrivals from the Mainland must hold either a certificate of a negative result of or a certificate of specimen collection for nucleic acid test issued by a qualified institution recognized by the health authorises or the Mainland within the past seven days; otherwise they are required to submit to a nucleic acid test.  Individuals contravening the requirements may be subject to mandatory isolation in addition to corresponding criminal liabilities.
type_sub_cat: Health Certificates
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From May 11, all arrivals from the Mainland must hold either a certificate of a negative result of or a certificate of specimen collection for nucleic acid test issued by a qualified institution recognized by the health authorises or the Mainland within the past seven days; otherwise they are required to submit to a nucleic acid test.  Individuals contravening the requirements may be subject to mandatory isolation in addition to corresponding criminal liabilities.
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting from May 11, “centralized isolation medical observation” is tentatively suspended for non-resident workers from the Mainland who habitually reside in Zhuhai with a Zhuhai resident identity card or a Zhuhai residence permit, but the said persons are nonetheless required to observe relevant requirements and regulations prior to, upon, and after arrival in Macao. UPDATE: Non-resident workers from the Mainland who habitually reside in Zhuhai with a Zhuhai resident identity card or a Zhuhai residence permit are now exempted from the policy
type_sub_cat: Health Certificates
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: From February 24, Macau required individuals who have been to South Korea within the past 14 days prior to their entry into Macao to undergo medical examination at Workers Stadium or Taipa Ferry Terminal in Pac On
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 8, Macau required all arrivals who have travelled to Germany, France, Spain or Japan within the past 14 days prior to their entry into Macao to undergo medical examination
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 12, Macau required all arrivals who have travelled to Norway within the past 14 days prior to their entry into Macao to undergo medical examination
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On January 23, Macau launched The Guaranteed Mask Supply for Macao Residents Scheme. People holding permanent or non-permanent resident identity card or non-resident worker’s identification card may register and purchase masks at 56 contracted pharmacies in Macao. Each individual can purchase 10 masks every 10 days.
type_sub_cat: Masks
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On February 26, Macau established an electronic system for personal health declaration
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On May 13, Macao sent an emergency medical team consisting of local professionals to join China’s national effort to assist the country of Algeria in its fight against the COVID-19 pandemic.
type_sub_cat: Unspecified Health Staff
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On August 21, Macau announced it is providing one free COVID-19 test for Macau residents and non-resident workers.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting from 8th March 2021, the price of a self-financed COVID test would be reduced from 100 HKD to maximum 90 HKD.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Health testing of entire population under the government's jurisdiction
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On February 3, Macau announced that all bus, taxi, and light rail passengers were required to wear masks.
type_sub_cat: Hygiene measures for public transport
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: Starting from 20th February 2021, casinos in Macau are allowed to reopen for business while following disease control measures imposed by the Health Bureau, including screening body temperature, wearing a face mask and completing the Health Declaration Form.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Hygiene measures for commercial areas
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Chief Executive of Macao SAR ordered the establishment of a "Novel Coronavirus Emergency Coordination Center" to operate directly under the chief executive.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Macao will take actions to promote tourism and economic recovery step by step, including 1. support local tourism; 2.encourage inbound tourism; 3. promote neighbourhood tourism; 4. and more encouragement initiatives to air, land transportations. From CCTV news on 4th May.
type_text: Macao will take actions to promote tourism and economic recovery step by step, including 1. support local tourism; 2.encourage inbound tourism; 3. promote neighbourhood tourism; 4. and more encouragement initiatives to air, land transportations. From CCTV news on 4th May.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Macau government has rolled out 'Stay, Dine and See Macao' starting from 15th April to 31st December 2021 for Macao residents to enjoy subsidies on local tours and hotel staycations. It has also stated they do not intend to establish any travel bubbles with neighboring countries apart from Mainland China. UPDATE: The Macao government has established more specific plans to encourage inbound tourism and has stated it currently has no plans to establish travel bubbles with neigbouring countries.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_text: Macao will take actions to promote tourism and economic recovery step by step, including 1. support local tourism; 2.encourage inbound tourism; 3. promote neighbourhood tourism; 4. and more encouragement initiatives to air, land transportations. From CCTV news on 4th May.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From February 20, Macau required all non-resident workers, who are unable to present the certificate of completion of medical observation or alternatively return to their place of origin, to undergo a 14-day medical observation in designated venue in Macao.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From February 26, Macau required individuals who have been to South Korea within the past 14 days prior to their entry into Macao, to undergo medical observation for 14 days at designated venue
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From February 29, Macau required all arrivals who have been to Italy or Iran within the past 14 days prior to their entry into Macao to undergo medical observation for 14 days at designated venue
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 10, Macau required all arrivals who have travelled to Germany, France, Spain or Japan within the past 14 days prior to their entry into Macao to undergo medical observation for 14 days at designated venue
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From March 14, Macau required all students, regardless of their education level, returning from abroad to undergo medical observation for 14 days
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: From March 17, Macau required all arrivals who have been to countries/areas outside China within the past 14 days prior to their entry into Macao to undergo medical observation for 14 days at designated venue
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: From March 25, Macau required all individuals who have been to Hong Kong Special Administrative Region or the region of Taiwan within 14 days prior to their entry into Macao to undergo medical observation for 14 days at designated venue
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: With effect from 00:00 of 26th April 2021, all individuals who have been to Nepal or Brazil within the past 28 days prior to their entry into Macao must, at the discretion of health authorities, undergo medical observation for 28 days at a designated venue.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
